symbol.description:
Symmetry symbol refers to point group or helical symmetry of identical subunits. 

 Contains point group symbol (e.g., C2, C5, D2, T, O, I) or H for helical symmetry.

type.description:
Symmetry type refers to point group or helical symmetry of identical subunits. 

 Contains point group types (e.g. Cyclic, Dihedral) or Helical for helical symmetry.

items.description:
Each type of different subunits is assigned a latter. 
The number of equivalent subunits is added as a coefficient after each letter (except 1 which is not added explicitly).

stoichiometry.description: Stoichiometry of a complex represents the quantitative description and composition of its subunits.

oligomeric_state.description:
Oligomeric state refers to a composition of subunits in quaternary structure. 
Quaternary structure may be composed either exclusively of several copies of identical subunits, 
in which case they are termed homo-oligomers, or alternatively by at least one copy of different subunits (hetero-oligomers).
 Quaternary structure composed of a single subunit is demoted as 'Monomer'.

items.description: Subunits that belong to the cluster, identified by asym_id and optionally by assembly operator id(s).

asym_id.description: Internal chain ID used in mmCIF files to uniquely identify structural elements in the asymmetric unit.

pdbx_struct_oper_list_ids.description:
Optional list of operator ids (pdbx_struct_oper_list.id) as appears in pdbx_struct_assembly_gen.oper_expression. 
One operator id per operand in the expression (most cases have only 1 operator). 
If it's not given then identity operator is assumed.

avg_rmsd.description: Average RMSD between members of a given cluster.

start.description: Describes x,y,z coordinate of the start point of the symmetry axis.

end.description: Describes x,y,z coordinates of the end point of the symmetry axis.

order.description:
The number of times (order of rotation) that a subunit can be repeated by a rotation operation, 
being transformed into a new state indistinguishable from its starting state.

items.description: The orientation of the principal rotation (symmetry) axis.

rotation_axes.description: Specifies a single or multiple rotation axes through the same point.

kind.description:
Symmetry kind refers to the symmetry of the entire oligomeric complex. 
 Complexes may be symmetric, pseudosymmetric, or asymmetric. Asymmetric complexes may have local symmetry.

rcsb_struct_symmetry_provenance_code.description: The title and version of software package used for symmetry calculations.

id.description: A unique identifier automatically assigned to the symmetry term.

name.description: A human-readable term describing protein symmetry.
